posts.name: Al's Italian Beef
posts.note: Al's Italian Beef is a Chicago-based chain known for overstuffed Italian beef sandwiches and hot dogs in a bare-bones space. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Billy Goat Tavern
posts.note: The Billy Goat Tavern is a Chicago legend since 1934 associated with the Cubs curse and Saturday Night Live. 'Cheezeborger, cheezeborger' and more in an underground haunt made famous by a recurring SNL skit. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Blackbird Restaurant
posts.note: Chef-owner Paul Kahan's sleek flagship Blackbird Restaurant is known for inventive fare and a popular fixed-price lunch menu.

posts.name: Do-Rite Donuts & Coffee
posts.note: Do-Rite Donuts and Coffee is a chef-owned stop for artisanal donuts in unusual flavors plus gluten-free and vegan options and coffee. Don't forget to order a spicy chicken sandwich or the bacon, egg, and cheese sandwich for breakfast. Be sure to come early; they may close earlier than 2:00 pm if we run out! NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Doughnut Vault
posts.note: Doughnut Vault is a tiny bakery selling a handful of donut choices each day until the stock runs out. Owner Brendan Sodikoff started selling big, fresh doughnuts out of a brick storefront in the spring of 2011, and lines continue from early morning until the handful of flavors sell out. Outside, there's a communal table for enjoying old-fashioned, chocolate-glazed doughnuts and salted peanuts, with cheap cups of coffee.

posts.name: Dove's Luncheonette
posts.note: Dove's Luncheonette is a Tex-Mex diner eats plus cocktails and lots of tequila in retro digs with counter seats and a jukebox. The burnt ends hash I saw on TV look like the thing to order when you're there.

posts.name: Girl & the Goat
posts.note: Girl and the Goat is the hot spot where Stephanie Izard serves up innovative small plates from a dramatic open kitchen. The Girl & the Goat opened with the goal of serving a family-style menu of tasty, bold flavored foods with global influences in a fun and lively setting that makes their guests feel at home from the moment they walk in the door.

posts.name: Jim's Original
posts.note: Jim's Original is an old-school 24/7 hot dog stand (started in 1939) boasting the original Maxwell Street Polish sausage. You need to order a pork chop sandwich too.

posts.name: Jimmy's Red Hots
posts.note: Jimmy's Red Hots is a counter-serve stand slinging hot dogs, Polish sausages, fries, and tamales for over 55 years.

posts.name: Johnnie's Beef
posts.note: Johnnie's Beef is a tiny, no-frills, cash-only hot dog stand serving sausage and beef plus Italian ice, fries, and shakes.

posts.name: Kuma's Corner
posts.note: Kuma's Corner is a busy, hopping pub known for its long list of creative burgers and its rock 'n' roll soundtrack. I have heard you need to order one of their burgers. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: The Mutiny
posts.note: The Mutiny is a dive rock club is featuring free rock, punk, and metal shows plus beer and artistic tiles on the ceilings.

posts.name: Old Town Ale House
posts.note: Old Town Ale House is laid-back, a cash-only dive bar near Second City with a storied past, old-school jukebox and funky art.

posts.name: The Publican
posts.note: The Publican is a creative seafood and pork-focused menu plus global brews in a hip setting with communal tables.

posts.name: Publican Quality Meats
posts.note: Publican Quality Meats is an American cafe offering charcuterie, pastries, and sandwiches along with an on-site butcher and market.

posts.name: RPM Steak
posts.note: Chophouse with a modern menu of prime cuts, raw-bar items and more in a sleek setting with banquettes. I hear you need to order the beef cheese burger and the lamb burger with middle eastern spices.

posts.name: Sweet Maple Cafe
posts.note: Country-style comfort food including all-day breakfasts and hearty lunches served in a homey space.

posts.name: Top Notch Beefburgers
posts.note: South Side spot has been serving burgers, beef-fat fries, and shakes since 1942.

posts.name: urbanbelly
posts.note: The functional eatery is whipping up hearty Asian fusion grub in straightforward digs with communal tables. I heard the thing to order there are their dumplings.

posts.name: Valois Restaurant
posts.note: A counter-service smorgasbord of American comfort food served in a casual, muraled space. NOTE: Cash only.
